title: Transit visa
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== (Subclass 771) Transit visa This visa allows you up to 72 hours to transit Australia on your way to another country. You can also use this visa if you need to join a ship as a crew member and you hold a Maritime Crew Visa. If you already hold an Australian visa you may not need a Transit visa. Check VEVO or your ImmiAccount first. If we grant you a Transit visa this will end most other Australian visas that you may hold. Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel. Check if you are eligible to transit without a visa Stay No longer than 72 hours Cost Free Processing times For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the visa processing time guide tool . This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application. With this visa, you can transit through Australia for no longer than 72 hours enter Australia by air before joining the crew of an eligible ship as a Maritime Crew visa (subclass 988) holder, within 5 days of your arrival. See all conditions Check your eligibility You must be outside Australia be transiting Australia, have evidence of a confirmed booking to travel to another country within 72 hours of arriving in Australia with the correct documents to enter that country if joining the crew of an eligible ship, hold a Maritime Crew visa and the necessary crew documents, and sign on to your ship within 5 days of your arrival. Help with your visa If you are getting help with your visa, before you pay someone, read information on Who can help with your visa application Apply About this visa If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel. Check if you are eligible to transit without a visa You might not need it With this visa, you can Cost How long you can stay Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder Stay longer Include family Apply from Processing times Your obligations You might not need it All non-citizens need a visa or permission to enter Australia. This includes those staying for a short time or just transiting and not leaving the airport. You may not need a Transit visa if you already hold another valid Australian temporary or permanent visa, and that visa permits you to transit Australia. If you already hold a visa to Australia If you already hold a visa to Australia, applying for and being granted a Transit visa will likely end your other visa. If you want to use the other visa in the future you will need to re-apply and pay any applicable fee. If you want to use your other visa to transit through Australia, be aware that different Australian visas can expire at different times. Check ImmiAccount for your Visa Grant Notice or VEVO to see what visa duration and travel limits apply to your visa. Some Australian visas are only valid for a set time. This time starts after you first arrive in Australia, no matter how short that first visit may be. Some visas are only valid for a single entry to Australia. If these circumstances apply to you, you may wish to rethink your travel and visa arrangements. Other visas may allow you multiple trips to Australia and how long you can stay resets each time you arrive. Before you consider your visa options for transiting through Australia, check: transit facilities at Australian airports your travel arrangements if you are eligible to transit without a visa You may not need a Transit visa if you are: a NZ passport holder who meets the eligibility requirements for a Special Category (subclass 444) visa (SCV) eligible for: an Electronic Travel Authority (ETA) Visitor visa an eVisitor visa an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Business Travel Card (ABTC) These visas permit the holder to Transit through Australia. They also permit a longer period of stay. With this visa, you can enter Australia and stay for no longer than 72 hours before leaving by air or sea enter Australia by air to join the crew of an eligible ship within 5 days of arrival as a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder. Cost Free. How long you can stay No longer than 72 hours, unless you are the holder of a Maritime Crew visa. Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder You have 5 days from arrival by air to sign onto your eligible ship, otherwise your MCV will cease and you may become an unlawful non-citizen. You will need to apply for a new Transit visa on each occasion you need to enter Australia by air to join a ship. Stay longer You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. If you want to stay longer, you must apply for another visa. Explore visa options Include family You can't include family. You must make a separate application for each person travelling. This includes babies on their parent's passport. Apply from You must be outside Australia when you apply and when we decide your application. Processing times For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the visa processing time guide tool . This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application. Your obligations You must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws. Learn more about conditions for this visa Eligibility If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel. Check if you are eligible to transit without a visa Leave Australia within 72 hours (unless also holding a Maritime Crew (subclass 988) visa) You must leave Australia within 72 hours unless you also hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV). If you hold an MCV and arrive in Australia by air on a Transit visa, you must join your ship within 5 days. Meet our health requirement You must meet our health requirement Meet our character requirement You must meet our character requirement Meet our biometrics requirement You must meet our biometrics requirement Have health insurance Details You are personally liable for all your healthcare costs while you are in Australia. Medical insurance helps limit your financial liability. We might make adequate health cover for the whole of your stay a requirement for grant of this visa. Your health cover should cover you for medically necessary treatment, including transport. See what we consider adequate health insurance Learn more about health insurance for overseas visitors Reciprocal healthcare agreements Some countries have a reciprocal healthcare agreement with Australia. Find out more from Services Australia about reciprocal healthcare agreements Have paid back your debt to the Australian Government If you or any family members (including those who don't apply for the visa with you) owe the Australian Government money, you or they must have paid it back or arranged to pay it back. Where applicable, hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) If entering by air to join the crew of an eligible ship, you must hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) Sign the Australian values statement If you are 18 years of age or older, you must acknowledge the Australian Values Statement . This confirms you will respect the Australian way of life and obey Australian laws when you apply for the visa.​ Best interests of the child We might not grant this visa if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18. Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our step by step guide. Step by step If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel. Check if you are eligible to transit without a visa Step 1 Before you apply Find out if you need a Transit visa by checking your eligibility. If you are from an eligible country you may be eligible to Transit without a Visa (TWOV) see Travellers eligible to transit without a visa (TWOV) You may not need a Transit visa if you are: a NZ passport holder who meets the eligibility requirements for a Special Category (subclass 444) visa (SCV) or are eligible, for: an Electronic Travel Authority (ETA) Visitor visa or an eVisitor visa as these visas permit the holder to Transit through Australia. They also permit a longer period of stay. You may not need a Transit visa if you already hold another valid Australian temporary or permanent visa, and that visa permits you to transit Australia. You can check your visa conditions on VEVO Ensure you apply for the visa well ahead of your travel. Provide all the required documents to prevent delays. We may still need more information from you and time to assess that information. Show steps Get help with your application Only some people can help you with your application. If you appoint someone to give you immigration assistance they must be: registered migration agent legal practitioner , or an exempt person You can appoint anyone to receive documents on your behalf relating to your visa matter. For more information see Authorised Recipients See how Step 2 Gather your documents Show steps Provide accurate information See what happens if you can't prove your identity or don't provide accurate information Transit through Australia See how Identity documents Provide: certified copy of National Identity Card (both sides) if you have one certified copy of the pages of your current passport showing your: photo personal details passport issue and expiry dates one recent passport sized photograph of your head and shoulders against a plain background. See how Other documents Provide: your plans while in Australia confirmation of booking from Australia to another country within 72 hours of arrival. This can be in the form of a ticket evidence that you can enter the other country, such as a visa or other entry authority. See how Sea crew transit See how Identity documents Provide: certified copy of National Identity Card (both sides) if you have one certified copy of the pages of your current passport showing your: photo personal details passport issue and expiry dates one recent passport sized photograph of your head and shoulders against a plain background. See how Documents from you Provide documents: showing your employment on the ship you are joining in Australia showing your travel arrangements to another country that show the ship you will be joining is an eligible ship that show your seafarer’s identity, such as your seafarer’s Identity Document or Card. See how Documents from the shipping agent We need a statement from the vessel's local shipping/handling agent. The statement must include: your name the name of the person you are replacing the name of the company employing you the name of the ship you will join the date you intend to arrive in Australia the port and date you expect to join the ship if the person writing the statement is not the ship's owner, a copy of the request for crew from the ship’s agent in Australia. The request should contain the details of all crew members applying for visas. See how Tell us you are getting help To nominate someone to: receive your correspondence, use Form 956A Appointment or withdrawal of an authorised recipient (301KB PDF) provide immigration assistance, use Form 956 Appointment of a registered migration agent, legal practitioner or exempt person (308KB PDF) Upload your written notification or your forms to ImmiAccount See how Prepare your documents See how Translate Have all non-English documents translated into English. Provide original and translated documents in your application. Translators in Australia must be accredited by the National Accreditation Authority for Translators and Interpreters Translators outside Australia do not have to be accredited. But on each translation, they must include their: full name address and telephone number and qualifications and experience in the language they are translating. These details must be in English. See how Certify Do not certify police certificates. You need to send us the originals. For all other documents we need a certified copy . This includes: non-English documents and English translations. See how Send Send us: original police certificates certified copies of all other documents as much information as possible to help us decide on your application one copy of each document, even if you are using it to show more than one thing all relevant documents with your application. See how Step 3 Apply for the visa ​ Show steps Provide accurate information Provide accurate information. See what happens if you can't prove your identity or don't provide accurate information Apply online Apply in ImmiAccount Attach documents Submit family applications together. Step 4 After you apply See what you can and must do after you apply. Show steps What will happen after you apply We will let you know when we have received your application. Status updates We can’t give updates on applications within the standard processing time You can check if we need more information from you in ImmiAccount Biometrics We might ask for biometrics (fingerprints and photo). We will let you know if you need to provide them. Mistakes on your application Let us know as soon as you can if you made a mistake on your application. Complete Form 1023 Notification of incorrect answers (168KB PDF) Help with your application Let us know if you no longer want someone to: receive your correspondence - complete Form 956A Appointment or withdrawal of an authorised recipient (301KB PDF) provide immigration advice - complete Form 956 Appointment of a registered migration agent, legal practitioner or exempt person (308KB PDF) Upload your written notification or your forms to ImmiAccount For more information see Who can help you with your application See how Tell us if things change Tell us if things change after you lodge your application but before we have made a decision. Things you need to let us know about include: you want to withdraw your application changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See what to do if your situation changes See how Step 5 Visa outcome You must be outside Australia when we decide your visa application. We will let you know our decision in writing. If we grant your visa, we will tell you: your visa grant number the date your visa starts and your visa conditions, if applicable. Keep a copy of the decision. If we refuse your visa, we will tell you: why we refused the visa and whether you have a right to a review of the decision. When you have this visa If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel. Check if you are eligible to transit without a visa Coming to Australia In Australia Leaving Australia Coming to Australia Before you leave Check your travel documents You must have: a valid visa to enter Australia a valid passport or other travel document. At the border Completing an Incoming Passenger Card Everyone who arrives in Australia must complete an Incoming Passenger Card . You will receive this on-board your flight. Leaving the airport faster We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you use SmartGate In Australia What you can do when you have this visa You can be in Australia no longer than: 72 hours while you wait to leave by air or 5 days if you are a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder and leaving by sea and signing onto an eligible ship. You can go sightseeing or visit family or friends before you depart. Your visa will come with conditions attached to it. To see your conditions use VEVO What you must do on this visa You must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws. See your visa grant letter or your conditions in VEVO Tell us if things change Things you might need to let us know about include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to tell us if there is a change in your situation See how long you can stay You can stay for no longer than 72 hours, or 5 days if you are a Maritime Crew visa holder. To see when you must leave, use VEVO Staying longer You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. You must apply for a new visa if you want to stay longer. Proving you have a visa To prove you have a visa and show your conditions to someone, use VEVO To get proof of your travel in and out of Australia you can request your international movement records. Leaving Australia Before you leave Check your travel documents You must have a valid passport or other valid travel document to leave Australia. At the border Leaving the airport faster We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you use SmartGate After you leave Proving you have been to Australia To get proof of your travel in and out of Australia you can request your international movement records
main_content:
===== main placeholder ==========================================
(Subclass 771)

# Transit visa

Transit visa

This visa allows you up to 72 hours to transit Australia on your way to another country. You can also use this visa if you need to join a ship as a crew member and you hold a Maritime Crew Visa. 
If you already hold an Australian visa you may not need a Transit visa. Check VEVO or your ImmiAccount first. If we grant you a Transit visa this will end most other Australian visas that you may hold.

This visa allows you up to 72 hours to transit Australia on your way to another country. You can also use this visa if you need to join a ship as a crew member and you hold a Maritime Crew Visa. 
If you already hold an Australian visa you may not need a Transit visa. Check VEVO or your ImmiAccount first. If we grant you a Transit visa this will end most other Australian visas that you may hold.

This visa allows you up to 72 hours to transit Australia on your way to another country. You can also use this visa if you need to join a ship as a crew member and you hold a Maritime Crew Visa. 
If you already hold an Australian visa you may not need a Transit visa. Check VEVO or your ImmiAccount first. If we grant you a Transit visa this will end most other Australian visas that you may hold.

If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel.

If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel.

#### Stay

Stay

#### Cost

Cost

Free

#### Processing times

Processing times

For an indication of processing times for this visa, use thevisa processing time guide tool. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the
visa processing time guide tool
. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

#### With this visa, you can

With this visa, you can
- transit through Australia for no longer than 72 hours
transit through Australia for no longer than 72 hours
- enter Australia by air before joining the crew of an eligible ship as aMaritime Crew visa (subclass 988)holder, within 5 days of your arrival.
enter Australia by air before joining the crew of an eligible ship as a
Maritime Crew visa (subclass 988)
holder, within 5 days of your arrival.

See all conditions

See all conditions

Check your eligibility

Check your eligibility

#### You must

You must
- be outside Australia
be outside Australia
- be transiting Australia, have evidence of a confirmed booking to travel to another country within 72 hours of arriving in Australia with the correct documents to enter that country
be transiting Australia, have evidence of a confirmed booking to travel to another country within 72 hours of arriving in Australia with the correct documents to enter that country
- if joining the crew of an eligible ship, hold a Maritime Crew visa and the necessary crew documents, and sign on to your ship within 5 days of your arrival.
if joining the crew of an eligible ship, hold a Maritime Crew visa and the necessary crew documents, and sign on to your ship within 5 days of your arrival.

#### Help with your visa

Help with your visa

If you are getting help with your visa, before you pay someone, read information onWho can help with your visa application.

If you are getting help with your visa, before you pay someone, read information on
Who can help with your visa application
.

## You might not need it

You might not need it

All non-citizens need a visa or permission to enter Australia. This includes those staying for a short time or just transiting and not leaving the airport. You may not need a Transit visa if you already hold another valid Australian temporary or permanent visa, and that visa permits you to transit Australia.

All non-citizens need a visa or permission to enter Australia. This includes those staying for a short time or just transiting and not leaving the airport. You may not need a Transit visa if you already hold another valid Australian temporary or permanent visa, and that visa permits you to transit Australia.

### If you already hold a visa to Australia

If you already hold a visa to Australia

If you already hold a visa to Australia, applying for and being granted a Transit visa will likely end your other visa. If you want to use the other visa in the future you will need to re-apply and pay any applicable fee.

If you already hold a visa to Australia, applying for and being granted a Transit visa will likely end your other visa. If you want to use the other visa in the future you will need to re-apply and pay any applicable fee.

If you want to use your other visa to transit through Australia, be aware that different Australian visas can expire at different times. Check ImmiAccount for your Visa Grant Notice or VEVO to see what visa duration and travel limits apply to your visa.

If you want to use your other visa to transit through Australia, be aware that different Australian visas can expire at different times. Check ImmiAccount for your Visa Grant Notice or VEVO to see what visa duration and travel limits apply to your visa.

Some Australian visas are only valid for a set time. This time starts after you first arrive in Australia, no matter how short that first visit may be. Some visas are only valid for a single entry to Australia.

Some Australian visas are only valid for a set time. This time starts after you first arrive in Australia, no matter how short that first visit may be. Some visas are only valid for a single entry to Australia.

If these circumstances apply to you, you may wish to rethink your travel and visa arrangements.

If these circumstances apply to you, you may wish to rethink your travel and visa arrangements.

Other visas may allow you multiple trips to Australia and how long you can stay resets each time you arrive.

Other visas may allow you multiple trips to Australia and how long you can stay resets each time you arrive.

Before you consider your visa options for transiting through Australia, check:

Before you consider your visa options for transiting through Australia, check:
- transit facilities at Australian airports
transit facilities at Australian airports
- your travel arrangements
your travel arrangements
- if you areeligible to transit without a visa.
if you are
eligible to transit without a visa
.

You may not need a Transit visa if you are:

You may not need a Transit visa if you are:
- a NZ passport holder who meets the eligibility requirements for aSpecial Category (subclass 444) visa (SCV)
a NZ passport holder who meets the eligibility requirements for a
Special Category (subclass 444) visa (SCV)
- eligible for:anElectronic Travel Authority (ETA)aVisitorvisaaneVisitor visaanAsia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Business Travel Card (ABTC).
eligible for:

Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Business Travel Card (ABTC)
.

These visas permit the holder to Transit through Australia. They also permit a longer period of stay.

These visas permit the holder to Transit through Australia. They also permit a longer period of stay.

## With this visa, you can

With this visa, you can
- enter Australia and stay for no longer than 72 hours before leaving by air or sea
enter Australia and stay for no longer than 72 hours before leaving by air or sea
- enter Australia by air to join the crew of an eligible ship within 5 days of arrival as a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder.
enter Australia by air to join the crew of an eligible ship within 5 days of arrival as a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder.

## Cost

Cost

Free.

Free.

## How long you can stay

How long you can stay

No longer than 72 hours, unless you are the holder of a Maritime Crew visa.

No longer than 72 hours, unless you are the holder of a Maritime Crew visa.

## Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder

Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder

You have 5 days from arrival by air to sign onto your eligible ship, otherwise your MCV will cease and you may become an unlawful non-citizen. You will need to apply for a new Transit visa on each occasion you need to enter Australia by air to join a ship.

You have 5 days from arrival by air to sign onto your eligible ship, otherwise your MCV will cease and you may become an unlawful non-citizen. You will need to apply for a new Transit visa on each occasion you need to enter Australia by air to join a ship.

## Stay longer

Stay longer

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. If you want to stay longer, you must apply for another visa.

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. If you want to stay longer, you must apply for another visa.

Explore visa options.

Explore visa options
.

## Include family

Include family

You can't include family. You must make a separate application for each person travelling. This includes babies on their parent's passport.

You can't include family. You must make a separate application for each person travelling. This includes babies on their parent's passport.

## Apply from

Apply from

You must be outside Australia when you apply and when we decide your application.

You must be outside Australia when you apply and when we decide your application.

## Processing times

Processing times

For an indication of processing times for this visa, use thevisa processing time guide tool. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the
visa processing time guide tool
. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

## Your obligations

Your obligations

You must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws.

You must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws.

Learn more aboutconditions for this visa.

Learn more about
conditions for this visa
.
Eligibility

If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel.Check if you are eligible totransit without a visa.​

If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel.

If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel.

Check if you are eligible totransit without a visa.

transit without a visa
.

## Leave Australia within 72 hours (unless also holding a Maritime Crew (subclass 988) visa)

Leave Australia within 72 hours (unless also holding a Maritime Crew (subclass 988) visa)

You must leave Australia within 72 hours unless you also hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV). If you hold an MCV and arrive in Australia by air on a Transit visa, you must join your ship within 5 days.

You must leave Australia within 72 hours unless you also hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV). If you hold an MCV and arrive in Australia by air on a Transit visa, you must join your ship within 5 days.

## Meet our health requirement

Meet our health requirement

You must meet ourhealth requirement.

You must meet our
health requirement
.

## Meet our character requirement

Meet our character requirement

You must meet ourcharacter requirement.

You must meet our
character requirement
.

## Meet our biometrics requirement

Meet our biometrics requirement

You must meet ourbiometrics requirement.

You must meet our
biometrics requirement
.

## Have health insurance

Have health insurance
Details

You are personally liable for all your healthcare costs while you are in Australia. Medical insurance helps limit your financial liability.

You are personally liable for all your healthcare costs while you are in Australia. Medical insurance helps limit your financial liability.

We might make adequate health cover for the whole of your stay a requirement for grant of this visa. Your health cover should cover you for medically necessary treatment, including transport.

We might make adequate health cover for the whole of your stay a requirement for grant of this visa. Your health cover should cover you for medically necessary treatment, including transport.

See what we consideradequate health insurance.

See what we consider
adequate health insurance
.

Learn more abouthealth insurance for overseas visitors.

Learn more about
health insurance for overseas visitors
.

### Reciprocal healthcare agreements

Reciprocal healthcare agreements

Some countries have a reciprocal healthcare agreement with Australia. Find out more from Services Australia aboutreciprocal healthcare agreements.

Some countries have a reciprocal healthcare agreement with Australia. Find out more from Services Australia about
reciprocal healthcare agreements
.

## Have paid back your debt to the Australian Government

Have paid back your debt to the Australian Government

If you or any family members (including those who don't apply for the visa with you) owe the Australian Government money, you or they must have paid it back or arranged to pay it back.

If you or any family members (including those who don't apply for the visa with you) owe the Australian Government money, you or they must have paid it back or arranged to pay it back.

## Where applicable, hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV)

Where applicable, hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV)

If entering by air to join the crew of an eligible ship, you must hold aMaritime Crew visa (MCV).

If entering by air to join the crew of an eligible ship, you must hold a
Maritime Crew visa (MCV)
.

## Sign the Australian values statement

Sign the Australian values statement

If you are 18 years of age or older, you must acknowledge theAustralian Values Statement. This confirms you will respect the Australian way of life and obey Australian laws when you apply for the visa.​

If you are 18 years of age or older, you must acknowledge the
Australian Values Statement
. This confirms you will respect the Australian way of life and obey Australian laws when you apply for the visa.​

## Best interests of the child

Best interests of the child

We might not grant this visa if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18.

We might not grant this visa if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18.

You may not need a Transit visa if you already hold another valid Australian temporary or permanent visa, and that visa permits you to transit Australia. You can check your visa conditions onVEVO.

You may not need a Transit visa if you already hold another valid Australian temporary or permanent visa, and that visa permits you to transit Australia. You can check your visa conditions on

#### Documents from the shipping agent

Documents from the shipping agent

We need a statement from the vessel's local shipping/handling agent. The statement must include:

We need a statement from the vessel's local shipping/handling agent. The statement must include:
- your name
your name
- the name of the person you are replacing
the name of the person you are replacing
- the name of the company employing you
the name of the company employing you
- the name of the ship you will join
the name of the ship you will join
- the date you intend to arrive in Australia
the date you intend to arrive in Australia
- the port and date you expect to join the ship
the port and date you expect to join the ship
- if the person writing the statement is not the ship's owner, a copy of the request for crew from the ship’s agent in Australia. The request should contain the details of all crew members applying for visas.
if the person writing the statement is not the ship's owner, a copy of the request for crew from the ship’s agent in Australia. The request should contain the details of all crew members applying for visas.

#### Translate

Translate

Have all non-English documents translated into English.

Have all non-English documents translated into English.

Provide original and translated documents in your application.

Provide original and translated documents in your application.

Translators in Australia must be accredited by theNational Accreditation Authority for Translators and Interpreters.

Translators in Australia must be accredited by the
National Accreditation Authority for Translators and Interpreters
.

Translators outside Australia do not have to be accredited. But on each translation, they must include their:

Translators outside Australia do not have to be accredited. But on each translation, they must include their:
- full name
full name
- address and telephone number and
address and telephone number and
- qualifications and experience in the language they are translating.
qualifications and experience in the language they are translating.

These details must be in English.

These details must be in English.

Step 5

Step 5
Visa outcome

You must be outside Australia when we decide your visa application.

You must be outside Australia when we decide your visa application.

We will let you know our decision in writing.

We will let you know our decision in writing.

If we grant your visa, we will tell you:

If we grant your visa, we will tell you:
- your visa grant number
your visa grant number
- the date your visa starts and
the date your visa starts and
- your visa conditions, if applicable.
your visa conditions, if applicable.

Keep a copy of the decision.

Keep a copy of the decision.

If we refuse your visa, we will tell you:

If we refuse your visa, we will tell you:
- why we refused the visa and
why we refused the visa and
- whether you have a right to a review of the decision.
whether you have a right to a review of the decision.
When you have this visa

If you will be in Australia for less than 8 hours and you are not leaving the airport you may not need to apply for a visa before you travel.Check if you are eligible totransit without a visa.​

## Coming to Australia

Coming to Australia

### Before you leave

Before you leave

#### Check your travel documents

Check your travel documents

You must have:

You must have:
- a valid visa to enter Australia
a valid visa to enter Australia
- a valid passport or other travel document.
a valid passport or other travel document.

### At the border

At the border

#### Completing an Incoming Passenger Card

Completing an Incoming Passenger Card

Everyone who arrives in Australia must complete anIncoming Passenger Card. You will receive this on-board your flight.

Everyone who arrives in Australia must complete an
Incoming Passenger Card
. You will receive this on-board your flight.

#### Leaving the airport faster

Leaving the airport faster

We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you useSmartGate.

We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you use
SmartGate
.

## In Australia

In Australia

### What you can do when you have this visa

What you can do when you have this visa

You can be in Australia no longer than:

You can be in Australia no longer than:
- 72 hours while you wait to leave by air or
72 hours while you wait to leave by air or
- 5 days if you are a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder and leaving by sea and signing onto an eligible ship.
5 days if you are a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) holder and leaving by sea and signing onto an eligible ship.

You can go sightseeing or visit family or friends before you depart.

You can go sightseeing or visit family or friends before you depart.

Your visa will come with conditions attached to it. To see your conditions useVEVO.

Your visa will come with conditions attached to it. To see your conditions use
VEVO
.

### What you must do on this visa

What you must do on this visa

You must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws. See your visa grant letter or your conditions inVEVO.

You must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws. See your visa grant letter or your conditions in
VEVO
.

### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change

Things you might need to let us know about include:

Things you might need to let us know about include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to tell us if there is achange in your situation.

See how to tell us if there is a
change in your situation
.

### See how long you can stay

See how long you can stay

You can stay for no longer than 72 hours, or 5 days if you are a Maritime Crew visa holder.

You can stay for no longer than 72 hours, or 5 days if you are a Maritime Crew visa holder.

To see when you must leave, useVEVO.

To see when you must leave, use
VEVO
.

### Staying longer

Staying longer

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. You must apply for a new visa if you want to stay longer.

You can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. You must apply for a new visa if you want to stay longer.

### Proving you have a visa

Proving you have a visa

To prove you have a visa and show your conditions to someone, useVEVO.

To prove you have a visa and show your conditions to someone, use
VEVO
.

To get proof of your travel in and out of Australia you can request yourinternational movement records.

To get proof of your travel in and out of Australia you can request your
international movement records.
